website_summaries.verdict: A great budget gaming tower case meant for anyone wanting a proper gaming setup at an affordable price.
pros: The tower features several grated surfaces to allow fan-driven air through to keep the interior cool
Top-mounted USB ports offer easy access for gaming peripherals and other USB devices
cons: Mounting screws fail to fit into the mounting studs properly for some parts

customer_reviews.title: No flow.
customer_reviews.text: The case is attractive because , hey, it comes with three fans with support for two more and rads, too! The reality is that even with every fan space used and fans maxed.... AIR FLOW SUCKS IN THIS CASE! The slanted plastic front cover you can see in the pictures blocks at least half of one of the front fans. THere is essentially the same problem on the top of the case, too. Cable management is a pain in the butt.. yeah there is space behind the MOBO for cables, but its thin. I will be replacing this case as soon as budget allows.
customer_reviews.author: Benton O. Addison

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaws and Cheap Construction
customer_reviews.text: The case feels cheap and flimsy. The front panel’s DVD drive slot is too small to allow a DVD drive to come through flush with the front of the case. It is an obvious design flaw as it does not look proper installed that way. The large number of drive bays is unessecary in a case this size and actually makes it impossible to fit dual GPU support and limits the room you have to work connecting the motherboard to the wiring. My GTX 1070 ti barely fits and there is a lot of flex in the case when seating the card. I am returning this case and buying something with better quality and that fits a standard DVD drive.
customer_reviews.author: John Tyce

customer_reviews.title: The case arrived in terrible condition the entire frame was bent making the IO ...
customer_reviews.text: The case arrived in terrible condition the entire frame was bent making the IO hole in the back not line up at all with the motherboard. most of the edges are very sharp and the case is very flimsy. Some good things are it does come with 3 OK fans and room for 4 more if you want. for the money if it had arrived in good shape i would have given it 2 stars all in all go for something better even if it hurts the budget you can get much better cases for less than $10 more than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design And Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: The case does the basic job, as long as the job doesn't involve a DVD drive. The case has a slot for the DVD drive, but the slot is so poorly designed and machined that the DVD drive won't actually fit. In the 30 years I've been building computers, I have never had this problem. I had bought two of these when I built my kids' computers, and I had to install the operating system by positioning the drive outside of the case. I give this two stars because I was able to work around the issue at install time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony H. Obryan

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price, looks really nice.
customer_reviews.text: Great case for the price. It looks really nice, especially the two LED fans in the front. The glass side panel looks really cool too. It has a good amount of space and drive bays in it, except for there isn't a whole lot of space between the motherboard and back side panel, making cable management sort of difficult. My only complaint besides cable management difficulty, is that the screws are really cheap and strip/break easily. I've already have 4 screws strip and 1 break. I would definitely recommend this to a friend, with a side not that they should buy screws separately.
customer_reviews.author: Angelady

customer_reviews.title: Only one 5.25 front panel and no 3.50
customer_reviews.text: The material quality is just about what I expected. The case is beautiful the finish on mine is perfect. It's a shame mine will be hidden under a desk. Plenty of room for geeky stuff. The only issue I see are exposed USB ports on the top of the case. It will be really easy to get something in them. I need to add something to this review. Be careful as to the 5.25 and the 3.50 drive bays. Theres only one 5.25 bay that's useable. So no room for a media reader. If you want a blue ray or anything like that you need to choose one or the other. You have no access to a 3.5 front panel.
customer_reviews.author: Don Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, good airflow
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, good airflow. It is a tight fit for anything longer than a Graphics card larger than 267 mm though. I went with a ZOTAC GeForce GTX 1080 Mini 8GB GDDR5X (see other review) so its a non-issue for me. The thumbscrews can be a little difficult. Easy install for 2 SSD, 2 optical drives and up to 5 standard HDD. You can install an additional 6 140mm/120mm fans (2 top, 2 Bottom and 2 side) the front USB ports a plus (1x 3.1 and 2x 2.0) Very light case. Case lights are a dark blue not purple. all in all a nice case on a budget
customer_reviews.author: Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Great Case for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I will buy this case again. Good size, will hold most everything you need for your setup unless your some sort of a hard core gamer. Still has a CDRom slot, (yes it's still needed in 2019, not everything is a digital download!). Cable management works ok. I don't really care about the glass side, a PC case is not a piece of art so I'm not sure why people care so much about that. I did have to cut the frame so the radiator would fit, not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Case is extremely thin and flimsy. They powder coated over the screws holding the sides of the case so it is difficult to screw/unscrew the access panel, and screws fall out. It's very poorly designed and constructed. The power and reset switches are cheap and the leads are barely long enough to reach some motherboard connections. I will never buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: You know you got a quality case when one leg is shorter than the other 3 and the whole thing wobbles. Also, I don't trust the "screw less" HDD tray. That disk will soon, you want screw in it, not some plastic clip. Rosewill seems to know this because they give you 9 screws for the HDD you can't actually use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Fan Splitter included.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case with plenty of room for cable management. 2 SSD bays, 3 HDD bays and 2 Optical Drive slots. 2 front RGB fans and 1 rear exhaust fan. The only draw back this case has is that the it does not come with a fan splitter to power one of the front fans you have to buy your own.
customer_reviews.author: AREC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Case, poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I assemble hundreds of computers a year. Why1 start? You must install DVD ROM first or you cannot fit it in after, I have assembled hundreds of PCs the last thing we put in are always DVD drives, had to completely disassemble unit and remove liquid cooling unit, very frustrating waste of time for design flaw. 5 of six mother board post mounts were stripped and did not stick in case so taking computer back apart to install DVD ROM was a nightmare as the screws holding motherboard to case would not release motherboard. Do not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tim ATC

customer_reviews.title: Workable case, crappy hardware
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this case to put together a new PC for the first time. It was generally okay, but the mb screws were garbage. Pros: Lots of room to work Has a spot for DVD drive 3 fans included Cons: Motherboard standoff screws didn't work, as they wouldn't allow screws to thread (yes I'm positive I have the right ones). Luckily I had some old ones left over, and I made do with those Case arrived dented on the side panel. It still functions, but it's really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-tower case for $50
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case. It looks great, better than the pictures show. The side window is very nice. I have used probably about 7 cases since I started building desktops, and this is the nicest side window I have seen so far. The case makes for great cable management. Everything fits easy without a whole lot of fighting. The case is also very big, probably a little bigger than most mid towers. Great airflow also. Two fans on top, two in front, one in back. I'm very happy with it .
customer_reviews.author: Robert Swiedals

customer_reviews.title: Great material quality and price range.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly with the knock people most often may say about this is its lack of "RGB" blah blah, but getting past that and onto the price and quality, its top notch. high quality metals design that isnt flimsy in the slightest with great support for every component from the 3.5" HDD to the 2.5" SSD as well as disk drives. Pre-installed fans 3 in all just add to the value. I guess the fact the siding isn't completely transparent to provide visibility to inside may come as another knock but again, price and build quality outshine that fact any day.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Fife

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case, I'm on my 5th PC build and I regret not trying this case yet! Very good quality for the price. The front and top panels are remove able. Easy fan installations. Not a ton of room but the case was only $50! I never used the stock fans so i cant say much for them but the USB ports and audio jacks work great. The only con I would say is "poppable" PCIe shields. They aren't the ones with the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin F.

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for expansion slots
customer_reviews.text: In the back, the expansion slots. A complete mess. Many good video graphics cards are dual width, thus they take up two expansion slots. This case must not have been designed with that in mind. You can easily pop out the first, second, and fourth slots. The other slots (third, fifth, etc.) however appeared to be just for show - they did not pop out. So I had to saw some opening to allow the card to work properly. I suppose an alternative would have been to try to change the graphics card to a single width, but that would have been ever more of a mess.
customer_reviews.author: CanesOneLaw

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, a pleasure to work with, and a insane value.
customer_reviews.text: I'm serious, I told a lot of people about this case and told them its the case to get when they build their next pc. The construction and building materials are top notch. Zero bending or warping. The sides come out to help with cable routing on the back and to allow larger coolers on the other side. The three included fans are quiet and push a lot of air when needed. The cable routing was so easy and efficient. Don't forget about the two usb 3 ports on the front which is really rare to find on cases in this price range. Its very simple, no other case can come close unless you double your money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price, Blue LED fans a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new case as my old was was too small for my 1060 6Gb, this one has ample space for card lengths, plus the back panel has spacing for cable management. Front panel mesh allows for nice airflow, while still showing off the subtle blue fans underneath. Quiet, cool, and spacious, without being just a basic box. Only change i would make is to add a second front USB 3, only having one seems odd when a single cable supports two ports.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Looks are deciving
customer_reviews.text: Most items you buy online look better on the webpage than they do in real life, this case is the exact opposite, for the $35 i paid for it, i just wanted a mid-tower case with usb 3.0 on the front IO and jesus, this blew my mind how good it looks in person, honestly, great case, a breeze to build in, definitely has MY seal of approval.
customer_reviews.author: Budget  Savy Tech User

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking case!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. The only drawbacks are it's hard to get the far left screws in for the motherboard, and I had a heck of a time figuring out the placement of the hard drive holders, but I eventually figured it out (wasn't expecting them to have the cables facing the BOTTOM, was expecting towards the TOP!).. as there was no indication in the manual, this took me awhile... BUT, the case is beautiful and everything worked the FIRST time, no hiccups, no headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Overall cheap case for budget PC works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, front end was a little hard to get off but it a little hard pulling it came off. Made it easy for cable management, make sure to buy some zip ties as this only comes with like 3. Don't care much for the led fans but I do like the fact more fans can be added.
customer_reviews.author: omar lopez

customer_reviews.title: Several quality issues
customer_reviews.text: The metal is thin. Really thin. My motherboard technically is installed however the rear slots where the graphics card ports are had to be bent a little as the machining does not seem to line up properly. The front of the case is designed to pull off to add drives and the like. Mine won't stay in place no matter how firmly I push on it, resulting in it sticking out a little. So yeah, my PC is now in this case however I don't care for the cheap build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Techtesting

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sure it’s cheap and not the best case you could get but for the price it’s great. I got it to rebuild a PC I was no longer using and upgrade it a bit to sell. Spent 50 bucks on this and sold that one for 450. It was a minimal investment to make that entry level PC more aesthetically pleasing and increasing chances of a sale. Perfect for that kind of business or if you want to build an entry to mid level gaming PC for a tween.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Oliver

customer_reviews.title: ... front look ugly but at least it keeps computer cool now for the cooling the mash the wire mesh ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is okay the two fans on the front look ugly but at least it keeps computer cool now for the cooling the mash the wire mesh and the Styrofoam in front of the fans I had to completely remove that so it would cool my computer but I keep my computer around a clean environment so shouldn't get too dirty but overall the the case is good but if you have a little bit more money I would buy this case and by some better fans. I have but more fans to put in it and I have every fan spot field
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: outstanding case for $
customer_reviews.text: excellent case, downsized to this litte guy with a monster setup. switched from an overkill watercooling setup to all air setup with this case and it keeps everything nice and cool with lots of air flow options. I recommend the windowless case so u can put a fan over the cpu with a top down cpu cooler, pro tip.
customer_reviews.author: Brice Coleman

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: It looks fine, but it's a pain in the fanny to move that piece of plastic where you put the disk drive. It looks like it should be so easy! Everything else on this thing is kinda par, I guess. I put it together a while ago and don't remember anything good or bad about this case other than the disk drive area being difficult to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It was very "inexpensive" and now I know why. Since I needed to build two new systems I had to go low budget on one of them. Serves me well I should have spend more and get another Rosewill. The case is quite basic and feels a bit on the cheap side. The filter screens are rather flimsy especially the bottom one. The thumb screws that holds both side covers are hard to remove and even harder to re-install. If you can deal with this then you cannot beat the price. As for the other system I spent a whole lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: A good solid gaming case.
customer_reviews.text: Airflow of the box lowered temps of my CPU and GPU by 5 degrees. Plenty of space for parts and wires. Hard drive and CD/DVD drives slide in and out easily. My one gripe is that the power supply is right beneath the video card, which means the heat coming off it rises into my GPU, but the fans, vents, and space actually make the video card run cooler when doing everything. The case feels like it's made of solid material that will stand the test of time. Very satisfied. Blue lights on the front fans look cool and the case looks like it cost more than it did.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel K. Stalling

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget case when on sale
customer_reviews.text: The Cable management in the Nautilus case is a bit cramped even with a modular power supply, but it's doable. Decent enough airflow and includes three 120mm fans (2 with blue LEDs, not really my thing). Wasn't to cramped to install my build in, especially compared to my old case. For the normal full price the Nautilus case won't blow your mind and be super amazing, but if you can get it on sale for $25 or lower it's a perfect budget case.
customer_reviews.author: A.D.

customer_reviews.title: Ok case
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble, and it seems like there is an average amount of space. Its pretty light. The screws seemed lower grade, and didnt necessarily fit in the hole as easy as other cases i have purchased. I would say that the overall quality was a little better than I expected for the price. This was purchased for my old rig when I upgraded my hardware. Havent run it yet, so cannot advise what that is like. First time purchasing from this company, may purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: The Unlaughing Jester

customer_reviews.title: This is a particularly good case. The back ("right side") is plenty deep ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a particularly good case. The back ("right side") is plenty deep enough to run all the cables so the board's lights really shine through the side. I've never turned on any LEDs because I always thought the wires detracted but this one lets me clean them up really well. It's not excessively wide and still fits on my mid tower shelf. Not excessively fond of the top-mounted USB ports. I cannot describe how many USBs I have broken/shattered in that spot but hopefully that's just me and not a particularly common issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Washington

customer_reviews.title: It's decent, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This case is a great starter. It has the usb 3.0 you'll want, has the fancy lights, allows for a large GPU, and has a cool viewing window. In retrospect, it doesn't have any cable management covers, there's a crack between the front panel and the body where the light shines through, the indicator light ends up being annoying more than anything, and the air flow is not great through it. Ultimately, it's a good case for the money, but next time I'd probably spend a little more and get a little nicer one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value!! I've used this case on two ryzen gaming builds now and I think it's the best "bang for your buck" cases out there. Having (2)USB 2.0 and (2) USB 3.0, as well as (3) pre-installed fans( the front two being blue led and one regular fan in the back). Now my dad is building a rig and using the same case. Great price! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but works for a temp set-up
customer_reviews.text: Not great, but does the job.. material is thin and bendy, but it's cheap, so.... Mine arrived with a broken foot pad and front face clip was also broken.. fixed with super glue, but yeah, mmmm,,, maybe not the best, as I said it was cheap and it does work for now. I will getting a better case soon.
customer_reviews.author: WatersMK

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a friend. Now I wish it was mine.
customer_reviews.text: Rosewill cases in general are wonderful cases. I've built a few gaming pc's out of these cases and they always come out great! This case in particular is beautiful. Plenty of room for ventalation keeps things nice and cool. The glowing blue LEDs 'almost' seem to swirl just a little bit. The case is light because many parts are plastic but it doesnt feel cheaply made as the doors are metal and the side panel is real glass. I bought a more expensive rosewill case for my build but I could have saved alot more money with this one. For the price its a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little case, i'm not sure what i was expecting, but definitely not this. this is a genuinely nice case, and the fans are nowhere near as loud as the other reviews suggest, mine are actually super quiet, even when they rev up to high when i'm playing a game... Quality case. I purchased this case cause the power button in my old one was sticking and the USB ports were going out. I purchased this case at FULL PRICE!!!! this is an Unbiased Review of this product
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cheap Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is a nice case for the money. I am dinging it for poor packaging and the dent in the side panel it had when it arrived. I was under a time crunch and so I am just living with the dent for now, but I will get a better case in a couple of months. Will not buy this one again. It works for now.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Front mounted ports are good quality. 2 bracket mounts for SSD drives are ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed, quiet, and the front led fans are mesmerizing. Is able to fit my huge sapphire Radeon R9 tri-x card in 1st pci-e slot without relocating anything. Front mounted ports are good quality. 2 bracket mounts for SSD drives are provided and mounted on opposite drive bays. This case was well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: We got this case because it was super cheap, it works as expected, the only problem I see with it is that doesn't have a fan on the transparent panel so you need to add extra fans at the top or.your computer will run hot, We builder a gaming computer we installed a GTX 1070 the espace was good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Moises C.

customer_reviews.title: Third one we have bought
customer_reviews.text: Layout makes our builds a breeze. Plus it looks pretty cool. Down side is the open side. This can let more dust in, past the screen filters. We laid clear plastic over theses holes. Speaking of dust filters, the front fan foam filter will get clogged up on you. And it's not easy to remove. After a year that foam filter will deteriorate and tore when we attempted to remove for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I like the pre-installed case fans. The LED isn't flashy, which I like. I'm not into the RGB thing much, so I'm cool with this subtle, blue glow. The 1/8th inch jacks are kinda loose and rattly in the top panel, but..... Hey, it's a cheap case, and so far they're holding up. Only time will tell there. Overall, it's worth it IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Mattersnone

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Not bad but not impressive. Update: case is junk metal so thin anb bends easily causing a 200$ motherboard to short circuit. Who is going to reimburse me? Also when tried to water cool I had to remove the MB to be able to mount it, horrible. Please do yourself a service buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mitabini

customer_reviews.title: Good, but mine arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Came bent a little in the side and back. I'd give the design and layout a five star, if you can get one not damaged in shipping (? maybe someone kicked it in the factory. ) I for example couldn't put the motherboard plate in the opening, because the top of it (the corner of the case, the edge with the screw in) is so bent. I just cut cardboard to purpose and moved on with my life, but a perfectionist would have cried.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E Edwards

customer_reviews.title: There are better $50 options out there.
customer_reviews.text: Acrylic slide panel scratches easily so be careful. If you want to install more/different fans then you have to remove the front and top panels which isn't explained anywhere online (there are tabs in the case that. you have to unclip). And if you're installing more fans then maybe you're having trouble with airflow. If so you can remove the mesh filter material behind the metal grates on the front and top. this will help airflow significantly but will introduce more dust
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Computer Case at a Greet Price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this case for two different computer builds and it works wonderfully. This case comes with 3 fans already built-in which ensures good cooling. USB 2, USB 3 and audio connections on the front of the case for easy access. I will definitely be buying this case again.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Meece III

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cheaper sales. If above 40 leave it alone
customer_reviews.text: Definite 5 star for the price i paid of $26 but if I had paid full price it was more like a 3 star so balances out to a 4 star. The good: 2 front fans and 1 rear fan preinstalled 2 usb 3.0 and 2 usb 2.0 on top Surprisingly nice power button Window can be taken off for cleaning The so so: Cable Management is impossible but not a concern for me since it is used in a cheaper build Case feels kind of cheap(again not a big deal because i paid 26) Bonus: window side looks excellent if you sticker bomb it
customer_reviews.author: andrew glover

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Amazing deal. This case is astonishing. Tons of space. The only con is the fan connectors are only three prong which mean they can't be regulated, they will run at 100 percent all the time. It definitely looks better in person.
customer_reviews.author: TheHatter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a new gaming PC for my wife. She loved the colors on the fans. They did not make very much noise. Case had all the usual front ports you would expect. Cable management was not the best, but for the price it was better then I had hoped. Build came out great and my wife couldn't be happier with the way it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel S.

customer_reviews.title: AVOID
customer_reviews.text: CD-ROM (standard size) doesn't fit: have to leave the front cover off. Hard drives (again standard size) don't fit properly into the bays, again have to shoe-horn things in. Considered sending it back, but I had all the parts and no other case...
customer_reviews.author: Fearadhach

customer_reviews.title: Avoid like the plague.
customer_reviews.text: This case is a nightmare in case for avoid like the plague. The mobo standoffs don't line up properly. The bay for the 2.5 inch drive/SSD screw holes don't line up properly. The PSU holes didn't line up properly. So basically I'm using half the amount of screws I'm supposed to because the other half won't line up. Cable management is God awful. This case is just bad even the one guy who used to show up on LTT said it was a nightmare to build in. I legit think a ps2 slim would be easier to build a PC in than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: stephon banks

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming-grade case at an unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, instructions easy to follow, great and robust materials with a very professional finish and god, it comes wit not one but -THREE- fans (the two on the front are neatly illuminated by the way!) which as a great plus. I strongly recommend people to look into the Rosewill products! It's been ages since I last assembled a PC from zero and this Rosewill case made my experience smooth and pleasant. I will buy more in the future for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Fabre

customer_reviews.title: Beat thing about it is the price
customer_reviews.text: Ok well first off my cable management is horrible as I found out this was my first time building a PC totally by my self but it works the case itself is really nice and offers alot to work with but if i had more knowledge I would have gotten a different case but the blue light on the front 2 fans look very nice
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not that great of a product...
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, however cheaply made (hence the cost). When trying insert my cd drive, it was very tight and did not allow the drive to be seated properly (had to insert from the inside, rather than simply slide in from the front). I can not put my finger on it, however I ended up simply using the fans off of the case and using my 9 year old case. I would not say that the case was awful, however can not say anything great about it either...
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Nice case but not complete package when received
customer_reviews.text: The case was nice and installing the power supply and morherboard was easy. However, the attachment oackage of screws and standoffs was not in the box. After contacting Rosewill an attachment package was provided but it arrived 3 weeks after the case.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Good

customer_reviews.title: A $40.00 gaming case!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. The design is fantastic. I have huge video card that fits perfectly due to the middle of the front case has been left open for a long video card, and the ssd bay's are mounted on the bottom of the two partitions in the case. The upshot is that it is a very small case, but it fits my vega 64 fine, and the B350M gaming plus mobo fits perfectly. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Curt O

customer_reviews.title: Very functional and low price
customer_reviews.text: I recommended it...controls air flow very good side window make it looks good too. DVD/CD are not a thing anymore so I recommended to remove it going to give you extra space if you want to do something else like me.. I'm thinking in put a bigger radiator soon
customer_reviews.author: Leibot1

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14 year old when his older brother decided to upgrade computer which meant some hand me down parts. Case shipped/arrived quickly, was packaged very well and the completely black side made decorating the case fun for my space crazy boy who used metallic sharpies to draw our solar system on the side.
customer_reviews.author: N. Belling

customer_reviews.title: I was glad I scavenged all the old mounting hardware from my ...
customer_reviews.text: Normally I would give this case a 5 star review but when I tried installing my motherboard I found the mounting pegs and bolts did not fit together. I was glad I scavenged all the old mounting hardware from my previous Rosewill case. I highly recommend testing your hardware for proper fit before trying to install parts inside the box. Other than parts that were tapped crooked it's a great case and the SSD mounting plates are an awesome bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mayle

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Case
customer_reviews.text: I installed an ATX motherboard inside this case. The only issue I had was inserting a screw in the top rear standoff. This seems to be an issue with most mid tower cases I have had. It did include three mounted fans which is a nice touch. I used the unused drive bays as a storage area for the extra cables as cable management was an issue. The sheet metal is thin and the rear screws fit very tight. Overall, not a bad case for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, good looks, good cooling and air flow
customer_reviews.text: This case worked well for me. I would have preferred an all metal case, but you really pay for those. This case had enough space for my build, but would have been too tight for a serious gaming build. Cable management is decent. The fans provided are keeping my components cool and clean. Great case for a budget build as long as your internals aren’t super demanding
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice midsize case
customer_reviews.text: Nice case for the price, I'd give 5 stars except for the fans. Fairly roomy, with room for a DVD player, if you want. Not too crazy about the noisy, single speed fans that come with it, but you can cure that with several PWMs of your choice. I like Noctua. Room for a fairly tall tower cpu cooler (6.2 incher fits O.K.). The captive thumb screws to hold the side panels are a neat touch.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Temple

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case!
customer_reviews.text: Seemed very well made except for the HDD side slides, they were almost rubbery. However, they do hold the two data hdd's nicely. Case is a good size and handled my large video card just fine. This is the video card I had to make a cutout for in my old case's HDD enclosure to make it fit. I have done two PC builds using this case. Both went together flawlessly and look good to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Watch motherboard/graphics card port alignment ,only 2 front fans are lighted.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking case , son loved it ,comes with 3 fans pre installed. But only had 2 fan headers on mini ATX board ; watch for that. Pre installed standoffs a little misaligned. Graphics card and motherboard ports dont line up perfectly . Other than that worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: john haywood

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Good Price. Quick ship.
customer_reviews.text: This case was the foundation for my super-fast and powerful new home-built computer. It gave me plenty of room to add in coolers, boards, and all the great stuff a system like mine needs. The overall appearance is great, and I really love the lights. My next build will use a Rosewill case as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Franklin, JD/PhD

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like my case. I am a first time builder so this worked well. However, I didn't properly install the MB to it and (my fault) it shorted the MB. So my advice to people looking to purchase this case is to make sure everything is elevated correctly before you turn it on. If not, you are going to have a bad time.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Great Price, Lots of Space!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how much bigger this was than my original case, but that's a good thing. Was a challenge to get the motherboard out of my old case so putting it into this roomy thing was a pleasure. I like the design of the interior and everything works as it should. Everything is labeled too! Overall I'd highly recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this case, nice airflow and the pre-install fans are kinda noisy, had to replace them, and the 2 fans that you can put on top one of them is almost completely blocked off so i dont know why they made that, But overall its an amazing case.
customer_reviews.author: Hung

customer_reviews.title: Decent Case
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a bad case however, its not to my fitting, its build Quality is alright it does have enough space for a first timer. I prefer tempered glass cases, and you should know this is plastic material and it will scratch super easy. So be prepared for that, other then that the air flow wasn't bad at all and I even fit my 280 rad into it. Its not a bad case to mod if you want to add functions into this case. But for the money you could def get a better case Unless this is your first time then I would def recommend until you get better feel for building computers.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good value if you are on a budget!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent value case. Not bells and whistles. Simple, and functional. Nice blue back light on intake fans in front. Pros - Lightweight and well constructed. Excellent cable routing areas. Dust filters are gonna be a big help. Comes with all MB mounting hardware and the three fans. Cons - Dust filters not easily accessible in bottom. No room for water cooling.
customer_reviews.author: JOANNE

customer_reviews.title: Rosewill Makes Good Cases
customer_reviews.text: I used this case in my recent gamer's desktop build. It's a nice midtower case. It's very good looking and well made. I'm very pleased with the results. I really don't like the recent trend towards cases made from tempered glass. Those things are excessively heavy, expensive, and fragile. I much prefer a more traditional design, like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great case for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Great case for beginners. Side of the case was bent a little during shipping but I just bent it back. Fans look good and work great. Just what I needed to build an old school windows XP rig for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great case, but missing screws!
customer_reviews.text: Received this case. Was great, until I found out I was missing the motherboard screws. No where in the information does it say what size screws they are! Not really wanting to buy a whole set of screws for just 5 more screws that are needed. I ordered this case used. "Condition: Used - Very Good - Item will come in original packaging. Packaging will be damaged." No where did it say that it might be missing screws.
customer_reviews.author: Player1NLatex

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Unfortuntly in the 3rd time hitting the power button it fell through the case took back apart and glued back on meantime switched the reset and power buttons working so far. Displeased with overall quality but cheap and does the job... get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: love the case
customer_reviews.text: love the case, love the room in it and the layout is great. the included led fans are a great touch at this price and add to the overall clean and professional look it give with a nice window to see all the horsepower you can pack into it. I would how ever say a few RGB strips really add to the overall look. and if you really want a center piece you can go with a mini itx motherboard and load it with RGB strips, fan, and components and even add figures such as funco pops to the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Lumos

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for under $50
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Fits ATX Motherboards USB 3.0 Comes with three fans Bottom mounted PSU Pretty good airflow (not a "hotbox") Price only $34.99 CONS: Very cheap material, you can bend with ease. No Power light only hd activity light. Not the greatest for cable management CONCLUSION: Yes I would recommend this case, however I wouldn't spend more than $40 on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Case for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my ROSEWILL Naultius case, came in yesterday in perfect condition no damages, all hardware present and looking great. Will do another review when motherboard arrives to complete the build.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: Bought this used.
customer_reviews.text: It is nice but there's not much room to fit the wire on the covered side. The metal support for the dvd and hd are blocking the SATA connection on my ASUS rogue AB350 motherboard and I, luckily, was able to plug in my Harddrive SATA wire.
customer_reviews.author: Th Si

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This case was so dang easy to put our parts into, it has good airflow and was just straight up simple No accidental cutting your hands against the case railing etc just smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable choice for build your own.
customer_reviews.text: Needed an affordable case for a DIY budget gaming rig. There are tons of options and I am happy I chose this case. It was an easy setup, plenty of room, no dangerous sharp edges that I found, and at the right price point.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin I Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality case
customer_reviews.text: This case was well thought out and clean with good cable management options, non-screw attachment for the drive bays, and two ssd bays with case fans included to keep them cool.
customer_reviews.author: OG_Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, but check all the usb ports
customer_reviews.text: Everything was a steal with this case. I couldn’t believe how nice it was for such a low price. I do however, have a few issues. 1: Led’s Are somewhat dim, which you can expect for the price 2: My BIG issue is that 2 random USB ports were dead on arrival. Had I not just spent time and energy building a pc from scratch, I would have returned it. Really disappointed in this, as it was a spectacular case otherwise
customer_reviews.author: justin shafer

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level/ budget case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for $40 on the week of Thanksgiving for a ryzen build I’ve been planing to do. So far I’m very impressed. While it uses a combination of metal and plastic for the casing it was pretty sturdy when putting everything in. Only main issue I had was cable management. Which at this price should come expected. Also I had to get a molex adapter for the two front LED fans but that was more of a of a different part issues and not the case. Overall good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: 1 on 2 different mother board fan control ports and smoked the harness adapter to the main power supply since both plugs are wired together than that I I like it. CDROM drive was a little tight but ...
customer_reviews.text: Should probably add some instructions for the non IT folds so they don't hook the fan power plugs to the power supply and mother board at the same time. This was a first build for me and I blew 2 transistors, 1 on 2 different mother board fan control ports and smoked the harness adapter to the main power supply since both plugs are wired together than that I I like it. CDROM drive was a little tight but it is 2017 so why did I even bother... overall id say it was worth the price and makes a nice night light too.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Matt

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Twice ordered & both times the power switch was bad the case looks nice but with out power its just a oversized paper weight. DO NOT waste your time & or money its JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Its black, sexy, and look's fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Fantastic case. At first I didn't know, but now I do. It's really great for the builder that isn't trying be the biggest and the baddest. A great mid-size case...only thing is cable management is difficult Not a lot of options..besides that, a perfect mid-level builders style case.
customer_reviews.author: Ixxion

customer_reviews.title: Its a decent case for the money spend a few bucks and upgrade the fans
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a budget pc build. Its not amazing but its pretty good for the money. Spend 15 bucks and get a 3 pack of better fans to swap out what it comes with, they dont move a ton of air. The extra room for additional fans is great and lots of room for drives. If your not overclocking you should be fine as is. For the money its pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Quiram

customer_reviews.title: Amazing case for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Fans are SUPER quiet, LOTS of ventilation, RGB looks nice without being obnoxious, and steel construction is VERY sturdy! Be careful though, space can be limited for the bigger graphic cards. I could barely fit my 1080ti with a z370 8700k motherboard. The graphic card slightly touches the glass pane, but no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room, overall great case
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, the only thing I wish was built better is the screws that keep the side panel on. Those connectors are difficult to line up properly. Other than that it works great! Lots of room and handy features, I do recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Broken front panel
customer_reviews.text: I recieved the case with a broken front panel. The case is small from the inside, which doesn't allow to manage your cables well. The fan are good but not in a way that I wanted. I changed to a thermaltake case and the temperature difference were significant.
customer_reviews.author: M.K

customer_reviews.title: It sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Why on Earth would anyone put 3 optical drive slots and 2SD card slots In a computer case that only has one optical drive open?! Just plain crazy. Garbage. Don't waste your time or money. I just did.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great case for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Fatastic case. Tons of room and easy use. Well built and has plenty of room to grow. I would recommend buying an extra two fans for the top to vent out. The air flow is limited with the bigger generation of GPU so if you have a 1060 or up, you will need more fan power venting out to keep the air moving. I have 6 vans in mine and the CPU stays about 80 F
customer_reviews.author: RangersFanatic

customer_reviews.title: 5⭐
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Has alot of places to put things and also has spots to tue to to hide your cables. The buttons are kinda in weird places but it looks awesome and cools great
customer_reviews.author: Tinman

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Spacious
customer_reviews.text: The case works perfectly and the included fans are very quiet while keeping the components cool. I've never before seen such consistent and reasonable temperatures showing up on the CPU, motherboard, and hard drives as with this case. No sharp edges either, and easy to use slide in drive bays with superb cable management.
customer_reviews.author: John Glendening

customer_reviews.title: Light and roomy with cord management.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Extremely light case. Easy to work with. SSD mount is nice. Back side panel has room for cord bulk to allow easy cable management. Lots of room. Fit dual Radeon HD 5870 cards in crossfire. Cons: Feels flimsy, but that's just a tactile feeling. Doesn't change the 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Swartwood

customer_reviews.title: Only one problem...
customer_reviews.text: My motherboard, b450 ROG strix F, had some issues with mounting. Could use all the appropriate screws because the holes didn't line up correctly to the motherboard. Other than that, didn't have any other issues. My build is up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the best case in it's range of price. Affordable, plenty of room, it comes with 3 pre installed fans (2 with led lights). The fans are nice and quiet. Acrylic side panel. 6 usb 3.
customer_reviews.author: Ravel Franco

customer_reviews.title: Best case for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing awesome looking case for a low price. Fits my huge hyper Evo 612 v2 and it has plenty of room, fans and pleny of hard drive docks. The case is just a little tall but not a big deal. I really like the windowed side door so you can see the RGB in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: this case is just what i needed.........
customer_reviews.text: the case has no issues at all, dvd bay works fine fits like a glove! got my gaming rig set up in 2 hours and hit the button started right up. great airflow to, not to big and not to small GJ rosewill
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F. Madden

customer_reviews.title: Looks AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 2 hours to disassemble my old pc and transfer it into the case. Set up was easy, stumbled a bit trying to figure out how to hook up the power button but once i referred to a diagram for my specific motherboard all was good. Wouldve liked if a splitter to power the fans was included but i repurposed one off the old case so it wasnt really a problem
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

product_meta.title: ROSEWILL Stryker M ATX Mid Tower Gaming Computer Case with Window, Gaming Case with Blue LED Case fans (3 Pre-installed) for Desktop / PC, Top Mounted USB 3.0 ports, HDD Trays support both 3.5" and 2.5" HDD/SSD
product_meta.description:
Color:Stryker MSpecifications 
Type: ATX Mid Tower 
Color: Black 
Case Material: Steel / Plastic 
With Power Supply: No 
Motherboard Compatibility: Micro ATX / ATX / Mini-ITX 
Side Panel Window: Yes 
Expansion 
- External 5.25" Drive Bays: 2 
- Internal 3.5" Drive Bays: 6(0) 
- Internal 2.5" Drive Bays: 1(7) 
- Expansion Slots: 7 
Front Ports: 2 x USB 3.0 / Audio 
120mm Fans 
- 2x Front (Blue LED) (pre-installed) 
- 2x Top (optional) 
- 1x Rear (pre-installed) 
- 1x Bottom (optional) 
140mm Fans 
- 2x Front (optional) 
- 2x Top (optional) 
Dimensions (H x W x D): 18.50" x 7.75" x 20.50" (bezel included) 
Weight: 17.00 lbs. 

Features 
NOTICE: Please make sure your motherboard equipped with on-board USB 3.0 socket before purchasing. 
Top-mounted I/O Ports (USB 3.0 x 2) 
Side Window Panel 
2 x Front 120 mm Fan, 1 x Rear 120 mm Fan pre-installed 
Removable HDD Cage 
HDD Trays support both 3.5” and 2.5” HDD/SSD 
Additional SSD Tray in the Back 
Supports up to 6 Fans 
Supports up to 390 mm long Graphics Card 
Supports up to 240 mm Liquid Cooling Radiator on the Top and Front 
Easy-access Dust Filters on Top and Bottom
feature_bullets: GAMING and SOLID DESIGN: Design of Rosewill Gaming Cases / Computer Cases brings you the ultimate gaming experience. An ideal full tower gaming computer case with tremendous and expansive space to build your professional ultra-performance systems.

HASSLE-FREE INSTALLATION: The ATX mid tower case offers tool-less installation of the 2.5" drives and 3.5" drives for a hassle-free build. Plus, the case has a bottom-mounted dust filter that protects the power supply from the threat of dust.

EXCELLENT VENTILATION: The Mid Tower ATX PC Case includes 2 x 120mm blue LED case fans in the front and 1x 120mm computer fan at the back and ROSEWILL Stryker M supports up to 2x 120mm or 280mm Radiator in the front. Support up to 160mm tall CPU cooler to offer excellent ventilation for your computer system.

SPACIAL and GENEROUS EXPANSION: Supports up to 240mm liquid cooling radiator on the top and front, up to 6 fans and 390mm long graphics card, high CPU cooler up to 160 mm, additional 2.5" SSD tray at the back, and easy-access dust filters at the top and bottom.

TOP-MOUNTED I/O & CABLE MANAGEMENT: USB 3.0 x 2, Audio In/Out and Fan Speed Control, the gaming mid tower gives users the best convenience to their gaming system and offers the ease of use to access the PC and huge space at the side for better cable management.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,909 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
